thread.title: North East MP slams Tories after she becomes target of Brexit campaign

author: Sean Seddon
title: North East MP slams Tories after she becomes target of Brexit campaign
text:
News North East MP slams Tories after she becomes target of Brexit campaign Helen Goodman has been singled out as a Remain-supporting MP in a Tory voting area over her stance on the EU Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
Bishop Auckland MP Helen Goodman is being targeted by a new Conservative Party campaign over her Brexit stance.
The party is going after outspoken Remainers in Brexit-voting areas, demanding they ‘Respect the Result’.
A new website has gone live featuring various Labour representatives and their voting record on EU-related issues.
While the effect of any campaign on the ground remains to be seen, it highlights the difficulty Labour MPs have in traditional heartlands which swung behind the Leave cause during the 2016 referendum. Helen Goodman (Image: PA Wire)
Detailed breakdowns of how areas of County Durham voted are not available but the final result for the whole area was 153,877 votes for Leave, comfortably outstripping the 113,521 votes for Remain.
But while the Bishop Auckland MP voted to trigger Article 50, she has a mixed record on other Brexit-related matters, according to the website ‘TheyWorkForYou’.
Darlington MP Jenny Chapman and Stockton MP Paul Williams are among other Labour figures identified by the campaign. The EU and Union flags (Image: PA)
Mrs Goodman, a Labour MP, has accused the Tories of a cynical attempt to use the referendum to target constituencies they want to win in the next election.
She said: “This is Tory spin. The MPs the Tories are targeting with this campaign are not the most ‘remain’; they are in seats the Tories wish to target. Read More
